reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Palestine: Supporting Palestinian Dialogue and Consensus

description.narrative: Since the 2006-2007 violent internecine conflict in Palestine, the Palestinian polity has been divided. Despite the seeming progress in the formal reconciliation process and several agreements between the rivalling factions in Palestine, there are several obstacles in the way of national unity and none of the agreements have effectively been implemented. Although violence between the factions has been limited, the continued division is resulting in great challenges for the Palestinian polity as a whole. Tog ether with its partner Masarat, CMI work in Palestine aims to address three types of problems related to the Palestinian reconciliation process: 1) conflict resolution structures; 2) actors and their relationships; and 3) the issues dealt with/ excluded fr om the formal process. CMI and Masarat aim to address the problems related to the conflict resolutions structures by engaging a wider group of actors in the reconciliation related discussions; by including overlooked and sensitive issues through the inform al process, and by enabling the reconciliation process to continue on the informal level in a sustainable way when the formal process is inactive. In terms of relationships, the problems are related to the lack of trust, interaction and connections between the Palestinian actors coming from different backgrounds. All these factors inhibit the possibility to agree in a mutually acceptable way on the critical issues related to Palestinian reconciliation. It also damages the social cohesion of the Palestinian society. As for issues, the project aims to broaden the agenda of the reconciliation discussions by including overlooked and sensitive issues through the informal process and by creating solution proposals to the obstacles that the formal process has not b een able to tackle.
